thread.title: Democrat: FBI Stonewalling On The Subject of Russia
thread.title_full: Democrat: FBI Stonewalling On The Subject of Russia

author: Jack Davis
title: Democrat: FBI Stonewalling On The Subject of Russia
text:
Democrat: FBI Stonewalling On The Subject of Russia "... we need to subpoena the FBI." by Jack Davis March 2, 2017 at 12:12pm Share on Facebook 506 Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Brandishing the threat of a subpeona if he fails to get what he wants, the House Intelligence Committee’s ranking Democrat said the FBI is not sharing everything it knows with Congress on the hot-button issue of Russian interference on the presidential election. 
“I would say at this point we know less than a fraction of what the FBI knows,” said Rep. Adam Schiff, D-Calif., after a briefing with FBI Director James Comey. 
“I appreciate we had a long briefing and testimony from the director today, but in order for us to do our investigation in a thorough and credible way, we’re gonna need the FBI to fully cooperate, to be willing to tell us the length and breadth of any counterintelligence investigations they are conducting,” Schiff said. “At this point, the director was not willing to do that.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Schiff said Comey needs to cooperate “because we’re gonna need that information.” Rep. Schiff: "It's going to be vital that we get the full cooperation of the FBI." pic.twitter.com/AWdxd0qNMi 
— Fox News (@FoxNews) March 2, 2017 
“And we’re better off getting that through the voluntary cooperation of the FBI than having to contemplate whether we need to subpoena the FBI,” he said. Advertisement - story continues below 
Schiff also said there should be a special prosecutor brought in to probe connections between Trump’s campaign and Russian officials. 
That’s contrary to the opinion of Committee Chairman Devin Nunes , R-Calif. 
“As of right now, I don’t have any evidence of any phone calls. It doesn’t mean they don’t exist … What I’ve been told by many folks is that there’s nothing there,” Nunes said on Monday. 
For months, U.S. intelligence agencies have been investigating Russian attempts to interfere in the presidential election. Democrats and some Obama administration officials have advanced the theory there was an inappropriate level of contact between Trump’s campaign and Russia. Advertisement - story continues below Father Of First SEAL To Die During Trump Administration Demands Investigation 
That theory was bolstered by revelations former National Security Adviser Michael Flynn communicated with Russian officials in December, but failed to notify the Trump administration about those contacts. 
Further, it was revealed Wednesday that last fall, while he was a sitting U.S. senator, Attorney General Jeff Sessions met with Russia’s ambassador to the U.S. 
Sessions did not disclose the meetings during his confirmation hearing. 
As a result of the disclosure, there has been a renewed round of calls for a special prosecutor who would not have any links to the Trump campaign to determine if there were any inappropriate contacts between the Trump campaign and Russia. 
“What we do know is that the Putin government is a bad actor who should be carefully scrutinized. And regardless of what side of the aisle you sit on, our country has a vested interest in fully understanding exactly what happened, outside the fog of accusation and political jostling,” Rep. Darrell Issa, R-Calif. said in a statement on Monday. “Any review conducted must have the full confidence of the American people, which is why I recommended an independent review.” What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
